/etc/wireguard.description: Choose a Share to store the WireGuard configuration. E.g.: create a Share called wireguard-config for this purpose alone.
/etc/wireguard.label: Wireguard Easy Config Storage

WG_HOST.description: Enter your WAN IP (externally visible IP), or a Dynamic DNS hostname (e.g.: vpn.myserver.com)
WG_HOST.label: WAN IP

PASSWORD.description: Enter an administrator password to log into the WebUI
PASSWORD.label: WebUI Password

WG_DEVICE.description: Ethernet device the wireguard traffic should be forwarded through (e.g.: ens6f0). For default enter value: eth0
WG_DEVICE.label: Ethernet Device

WG_DEFAULT_ADDRESS.description: Clients' IP address range, using x for the last octet (e.g.: 10.6.0.x). For default enter value: 10.8.0.x
WG_DEFAULT_ADDRESS.label: Client Address Space

WG_DEFAULT_DNS.description: DNS server(s) clients will use, separated by commas (e.g.: 8.8.8.8, 8.8.4.4). For default enter value: 1.1.1.1
WG_DEFAULT_DNS.label: Default DNS Server

WG_ALLOWED_IPS.description: Allowed IPs clients will use, separated by commas (e.g.: 192.168.15.0/24, 10.0.1.0/24). For no restrictions enter values: 0.0.0.0/0, ::/0
WG_ALLOWED_IPS.label: Allowed IP address ranges

WG_PERSISTENT_KEEPALIVE.description: Value in seconds to keep the connection open. If this value is set to 0, then the PersistenKeepalive functionality is turned off. For default enter value: 0.
WG_PERSISTENT_KEEPALIVE.label: Persistent Keepalive (second)

WireGuard Easy.description:
The easiest way to run WireGuard VPN + Web-based Admin UI.

Based on the custom docker image by Emile Nijssen: https://github.com/wg-easy/wg-easy/pkgs/container/wg-easy, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.
